content:
Posted: June 20, 2016
												I own the original.  Bought this one even though people said it's not worth it, and that it didn't add much if you have the original.  But I knew what I was buying it for.  I wasn't looking for the new character, or the "better graphics", etc.  I was looking for the increased difficulty scaling in levels.In that department it delivered in aces.  The challenge is real.  And that's what made me like this game in the first place... it's just so... much... fun.What people say about bugs is true.  Sometimes the zombies walk through the walls.  But instead of ticking me off, and wanting to ask for a refund... it instead made me go "OOOOH SH**" and started fighting.  It did not rob me of my fun... I was having a blast.  Once I did encounter a bug where I had to exit then continue... had to start the mission over.  I encountered it once through all my play.  Whatever... I can live with that... it's just so much fun.It got to a point where I stopped noticing some zombies passing through walls.  Because when your survivor stands up after searching (even silently), zombies right outside will notice you.  Before you know it there's 15 zombies inside the room with you.  Quite frankly you won't care (nor notice) that 3 of them passed through the wall... because a dozen of them just crashed through the window.There's nothing better than seeing the super-awesome powerhouse that is Amelia Crasman bust through the door of a house filled with zombies, eating a snack... and running the OTHER DIRECTION... leaving both the house and her vehicle behind in the background.  Because seriously... that house is a job for a survivor I DON'T like.  The size of hordes in this game is unreal... the days of casually standing there and fighting off an entire horde with just 1 or 2 snacks are over.You know what's worse than fat zombies?  Fat zombies who bring their fat zombie friends for a party at your house.  Yep.  Even worse... at higher levels... when you are grabbed by a fat zombie, it's instant death... there's no wiggling out of it.Bloaters galore?  Out of ammo?  No car?  You mean I have to walk across the field jam packed with ferals with only 3 snacks?  Everybody sick and dying?  I'm actually struggling to survive?  COUNT ME IN!!This new edition enhances this game's crowning jewel... the fun factor.  And for me, that was more than worth the price.

content:
Posted: February 11
												This game is the zombie survival game i would have killed for as a child. I always wanted something that scratched that itch, and DayZ didn't do it until later years. I played the telltale walking dead games (Which are amazing and you should totally buy) and that scratched that itch to a degree. Where as the surival in there was scripted, this game lets you recruit survivors and build up bases. Set up outposts and even more. So it really does it for me. Graphics: The graphics are okay, nothing more, nothing less. There are some lighting bugs for me, but i assume that is because i am playing in 4K. Story: Story is great, but you will be focusing on survival and morale. The game comes with the two DLCs' "Breakdown" and "Lifeline". Breakdown is a "Free Play" where you dont have to follow the story, you just get plopped down and you simply survive. You build up your base until you feel comfortable to move onto the next town over, using a old RV which takes time to fix up. Lifeline however, places you in the hands of the military, you start with all this amazing gear. And as the game progresses you lose that gear. So you go from badass, to normal survivor with benifits. It also gives you a full city to explore, that is ripe with resources and dark secrets!Both are great DLCs', and the main game is great too. Looking forward to State of Decay 2 if that comes to PC. You couldnt ask for a better bundle of fun if you tried!

number of helpful: 38 of 72 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												Unfortunately State of Decay Year One Edition has let us down. What was supposed to be, in the developer's own words the "definitive edition" of State of Decay manages to be worse than the original. I could tell the original SOD was unoptimized, having to play it on medium settings on a beast PC just to maintain 60+ FPS at all times. (And this is for a game designed from the ground up for the 9 year old X-Box 360) Well YOSE is far worse in that respect. YOSE has a terrible stuttering/frame drop problem that occurs regularly even on the lowest graphic setting. In a game with unforgiving perma-death of characters you have spent hundreds of hours to build and level, it is unacceptable to loose a character just because a long heavy stutter skip made you die in the middle of intense combat. Also the game just feels like it will crash if you bump into your PC lol. What I mean, if you bring up the steam overlay, minimise the game, someone on skype calls you while your in-game, doing almost anything in the background will cause the game to crash. I have found that even if you manage you unminimise the game by some miracle, the performance will be bad until you close and reopen the game. All the old glitches from the original SOD I remember are still here, including the ones that glitch your save file, requiring you to start over.I admit is was pretty cool to see higher resolution versions of all the old art assets as I was able to see and read things on signs and posters that I never could in the past.Overall I find the original version of SOD to be better overall. Performance is way better, has better load times, and I'd rather not have the gimmicks of YOSE that do not add anything to the experience. I'd rather keep my 60FPS gameplay with minimal stutter over higher res textures, non stop stuttering, and having to exit completely out of the game in order to respond to a Steam message. Also the flashlight has no purpose anymore in YOSE as every playable character magically emits light from their body.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												It was a typical night in town. Day 11 so far. Morale is starting to lower and one of our members  is beginning to let fear get the better of him. This needed to be fixed before a crisis would occur. This would be Jacob’s second new mission and so far so good with him. As Jacob, I took our fellow survivor out to kill some Zeds to loosen him up and it was going well so far. Until a random Feral came out and ripped Jacob in half before I had a chance to munch on my energy bar. It was terrible, just terrible…and also pretty cool. At its best, this is what State of Decay is all about. It’s random, enticing, devastating, and exciting all in one package. But there a few major problems that keep this from being a satisfying experience.GameplayState of Decay is a Survival Action-Horror game with RPG elements. Set up in a small town, you are thrust into a zombie infested world which acts as a hostile playground for players to explore. Your ultimate goal is to create a surviving community until military evac arrives. Gameplay involves fighting via third person hand-to-hand combat and shooting. As you progress, the community you help build will begin to expand and gain the ability to create infirmaries, libraries, etc. And the survivors that you play will begin to develop their own skills such as shooting, fighting, and wits while out doing missions or searching for supplies. The catch is that there is only a single save file with permadeath enabled. If a survivor is killed, morale drops and you’re switched to the next survivor. Progressing through the game requires story missions, side quests such as interacting and helping strangers and fellow friends alike while trying to survive another day.There is so much to do and explore in this game. Exploring your environment constantly brings a sense of danger around every corner and comes with its own risk/reward system. Finding supplies is uplifting and all, but making sure you have a plan for getting back is necessary as Murphy’s Law can and will happen.Managing your community means making sure that everyone is well fed, mentally and physically healthy, etc. As you progress through the game your community can continue to expand to different areas as a means of safe zones to prevent zombie hordes and other problems from arising. Honestly, I found this aspect of the game to rather shallow for specific reasons. For one, you can’t manage what other NPC’s should be doing; nor could you send your companions out to various locations for errand runs. Instead, you drive all the way over to the location and then decide to bring a runner, should you not have enough space in your inventory to take a load back home. This resulted in lots of precious time being wasted and monotonous at times. Not only that, at random times I would be making a long drive to a mission only for one of my runners to be trapped by a bunch of zombies, resulting in me having to drive all the hell back just to save them. This happened so many times that I had lost count.Combat is surprisingly satisfying. Approaching combat requires to weigh the odds for each method. Do you go all in with melee to avoid attracting other zombies or do you take them out from afar with your gun while potentially compromising your location? Monitoring your health is not the only important bar to pay attention as each character has their own specific amount of stamina that you need to pay attention to. Running out of stamina spells out your doom and requires a strategic mind to maintain while fighting. With the various amount of fighting abilities and specialties for each character, experiencing combat with each character was consistently fresh and exciting.Driving in the game is on the neutral side of things. Cars get you around but some have terrible and unrealistic handling.What brings the gameplay down are the extraordinary amount of bugs that you will encounter in the game. I can’t count how many times a zombie would spawn right next to me, ruining my attempted stealth run. Sometimes, zombies would simply spawn out in mid-air while you are driving and there was a time where I was forced to reset my game because I encountered a bug that would not allow me to talk or interact with options. For a game to have been around so long, it is quite disappointing to see such problems take you out of the experience. Don’t get me wrong, this is a very fun game to play, but the problems are as obvious as white on red.NarrativeThere is barely any story to really mention in this game. What I mentioned in the intro paragraph is what the story is basically about. There are story missions which are all unremarkable and side missions which help flesh out some of the characters in this world. It would have been nice to see more consequences for the death of a fellow survivor rather than a simple notification or some obviously sad music for five or so seconds. Consequently, this aspect severely affected my enjoyment of the game as barely any conversations are meaningful and are combined with shallow responses from your player character during side missions.Speaking of side missions, they’re mostly fetch quests with some go rescue this shoved inside. These missions have a timer on them unlike the main quests and not fulfilling them can result in a death sentence or loss of potential relationship building. Having to decide on which side quest to pursue is great and all but it is consistently bogged down by repetition and lack of surprise.GraphicsWhat stands out are the various environments you will visit throughout the game. Despite having ugly and blurry textures reminiscent of an early Xbox 360 game. The environment is pleasant to look at, but what isn’t pleasant are the god-awful character meshes and textures. Combine that with static animations and robotic conversations, the graphics department is a bit of a mixed bag. Though the combat animations are quite satisfying to view.SoundThis game wins in the sound department. Whether it’s hearing the satisfying crunch of a zombie’s skull being smashed or when firing your weapon, this game works well with what it has. Voice acting is at times decent and other’s just terrible. But the music itself was perfect all aroundEnding ExecutionThis is what almost killed the game for me. After a very tense fight with multiple hordes of zombies, you get a half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥cutscene with a few bits of dialogue and then the game ends, achievement unlocked. This was lazy, pointless, and pretty much failed to impact in any way possible. It was so anti-climatic that I kind of felt I wasted my time with the game. This method of ending a video game is shoddy, lazy, and shameful.OriginalityToday, there is an insurmountable amount of survival based zombie games now. But few have it done it as well as State of Decay. None of the gameplay really stands out, but the experience of success, loss, and just epic failure will stick around in your gaming memories forever. But its terrible graphics, bugs, and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ending keeps me from recommending it to anyone.6.7/10

content:
Posted: April 17
												I played the first State Of Decay (as in not YOSE) on my brothers account back when we shared an account and I bought this when I got my own account before we both knew what gameshare was. Now that the backstory part is over...Im giving this a positive review mainly because I can and I did enjoy both the original and YOSE version of the game. What really pushes my buttons is that this is 30$ and the original was 20$ (I could be wrong, most likely wrong). HOWEVER this game has only 2 loading screens, 1) for entering the game apon start up 2) when returning from home with certain characters.This game can really keep you on your toes hell maybe even make you want to levitat off the ground at those really REALLY intense moments where your favorite survivor is in a very bad place. Each "spiecal" zed/zombie (however you want to look at it) can make you change your strategy in an instant. For example: Bloaters, for some odd reason you packed a shotgun with you and you see a bloater coming at you. You also see a feral zombie off in the distance and now you wished you didnt pack a shotgun (or revolver, or gun without a suppressor) and you want to get away. You sprint away and then the feral spots you and then pounces on you. You manage to kick it off ya but the zombies around the area are overpowering you, next thing you know, your character is then RIPPED IN HALF by the feral making you want to break the monitor since that was your main guy. By the way, once a character is dead, HE (OR SHE) DEAD FOR GOOD. I mean its one of those games.Dont rely too much on one character (Hence the sick, tired, and wounded system) or else you might want to uninstall the game.The Bloater-Feral was based after a true story by yours truly.I still think the game is fun, even with 79 hours of playtime by the time I wrote this review. Plus I have not been focusing on the storyline since I always screw it up so I stick with Lifeline and Breakdown more often.

content:
Posted: March 30
												Do you like zombie games? Do you like survival games? Do you like sandbox games? Well, State Of Decay is a MUST for you.This game didn't have that much of a spotlight back in 2013 but surely it should be considered a masterpiece.For the first time you have control over an entire community of people and not just over one or two main characters.Each person you control has unique skills and perks that give him/her a particular role in your community.You have to pay attention to your resources (food, materials, ammos, etc) and at the same time you have to make sure that your people don't get sick of tired a lot during your scavenging missions, paying attention to their morale and helping them when necessary.Is interesting how you can switch between the characters to allow others to rest or to do missions while you are away doing something else, as well as keeping zombies away from your HQ that you can upgrade or switch when required.All the choices you make in this game are permanent so if you let a character die it stays dead living a mark on the entire community, raising fear and dropping the morale of the entire community.The "game over" feature is non existent in this game. When a character dies, you switch automatically to another going on to your struggling quest of survival. Plus there aren't really "main" protagonists even if you start with the same 3 people, at the very beginning.If you are the kind of player who likes to play a "different" zombie game, compared to the classics, then I suggest you to try this game out. Even if it's 4/5 years old, this game still kicks the♥♥♥♥♥of many other titles and offers you a total different approach to the concept of "survival" we are used to, thanks to games like Resident Evil, Silent Hill or Alone In The Dark.The graphics are totally ok for a game like this, however you can make use of mods if you want to give this game a new outfit. So if you are someone who likes to play a game only if the graphic is decent (sadly for you), I can say that you can still go on with this. It's really really worthy.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2016
												I like survival games, and I love zombie games.  And this is definately a Survival zombie game.But my love for these kind of games can't best the hate I have for games that let enemies spawn 3' behind you where they immedately grapple and knock you down.  It doesnt happen often, but the respawning zombies is completly out of control here.  You can clear a small room, turn around and see enemies respawn.   See a group of 15 zombies?  toss a molly at them, burn them down and watch a new horde of zombies spawn in their ashes.  In an empty field? Better watch your back, a special zombie will likely pop and jump you.Worst of all the game 'runs' when you have it closed.   If you want to heal health/stamina you are forced to log off.  Dont play for a day?   Your resources still drain (and drain they will, at best you will always still suffer massive resource loss every 'day'). Then there are the little things.. Find 4 medical bags you want to bring home?  You can only hold one, and cant store them in cars (trucks work, if you risk glitching).  Expect to ocasionaly get grappled though walls, have cars you are driving randomly suffer damage or flip over, and worst of all is having critical quest npcs run off infinately in some dirrection so that you have to reload and hope the game didnt auto save and corrupt your entire game.  Plus sides. I love the concept, and the voice actors are nice.  and it has enough guns and melee weapons that you have several choices for each character.   Unfortunately that cant make up for its down sides.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												Got this on Xbox 360 when it first came out, so technically I probably have over 50-60 hours playing it combined. It was the only reason I kept coming back to playing my xbox at the end of the life cycle. Amazing, you build a community of survivors and you have to scavange the map for resources and such. Original SOD is awesome and story driven. All DLCs are included in this version of the game: Breakdown DLC, is pretty much sandbox game in which you can play at building your community up until you run out of ressources to scavange in the map, then you can move on and start over carrying a few survivors over with you and doing so increases the difficulty. Also you survivors (in all game modes) can perma-death, which adds to the tension. Lifeline DLC is another story mode in a new map that let's you play as the military; that means, more guns GUNS GUNS, haha. Overall the complete package is a must buy, get it on sale if you've already played it in it's original form, don't hesitate if it's your first time (unless you want to, I'm not your dad). It's a game I will always go back to... until State of Decay 2 comes out at least.EDIT: This game when it first came out was 2nd only to Minecraft on XBLA sales.

												This review came about as a product of my own fear whilst buying this game. The negative reviews had made me a little on edge. I can now, safely say that this product deserves a positive review. The game is fun, replayable, and unique as it focuses more on survivor progression and communities of survivors than blowing zombie brains out (Although there is a fair bit of that too)  And in this way it creates a sort of tension as you fear for you survivors and their lives as you develop a connection to them. Overall this is a unique experience that I would reccomend to everyone who enjoys zombie survival games.Now, to address the negative reviews; Although I can understand why people who bought the original game would be annoyed, I also would like to remind everyone that when you write a review it is for the game, not the developers business practices. At the top of your review it says "Write a review for State of Decay YOSE" NOT "Write a review for Undead Labs"I reccomend all new players ignore these reviews as they are not aimed at you, but the devs.

content:
Posted: July 11, 2016
												I say it's a good game you just have to overlook the bugs and various other simple things if you know how to do it right. (AKA mods help)I bought this game for my brother for a birthday gift a few years back. He didn't like it why? It wasn't first person or something. I instead started playing it. Sure there's a lot of things that bug me about it. Number one  being the fact  that the game in itself for some glitch or another seems to run best on the highest settings which I have no idea why but if it's below maximum specs for me it lags beyond all reason.But yes there are clipping issues, Zombies phasing through walls, People being kinda dumb and taking the grenade launcher to stand on guard and destroy all your cars when they try to kill one zombie in the parking lot of your base, Some repetitive gameplay and missions that are so common that they are annoying at most times, Lilly nagging your ear off by telling you to check out them survivors she mentioned when you did that just five minutes ago, some broken guns that might have been added in from a mod or not I have no idea. Yeah there's a lot of bad but the game has a lot of good at same time.This is the only Zombie open world game I've ever seen that isn't and mmo or pay to win pvp, sure the missions are repetitive but in that kind of situation you kind HAVE to do the same thing over and over again to maintain a base, sure there is bugs but hey it keeps you on your toes.But honestly if you ask me it wasn't all bad and it's enjoyable if you look past all the bugs and mod the thing to improve some gameplay issues but this is honestly one of those games where if you love it, you love it and if you hate it, you hate it. My advice try the game. Who knows it may be worth your time and you might have fun. ^^

number of helpful: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2016
												State of Decay: YOSE Day One EditionThis game is incompleteSince back then in 2013 I really wanted to have this game. At the last sale I finally got myself to buying it. From what I had read during this long period of time, I had very high expectations. State of Decay managed to excel them.I have played for 11 hours until now and I have thoroughly enjoyed them. I wouldn't say this is the definitive zombie game but yet it is the best one I have ever played (it was my first zombie game ever xD).The core gameplay is real fun. You stroll around a pretty big map and try to survive somehow: you collect food/materials, you upgrade your home base, you make sure your crew stays motivated. Later on you even fight against various diseases who kill you almost instantly. Overall, it's very satisfying. Although it feels a lot like babysitting the dumb AI at the beginning, you learn to appreciate that the game always keeps you busy.Nevertheless, there are a few negative aspects which affect your experience badly.1. Glitches. Be it zombies under floors/zombies in walls or backpacks also under the floor.2, Lack of personalisation. You basically stay forever with the basic appearance survivors have by default.3. The ridiculous real-time-feature. I mean srsly, bros at Undead Labs?? All types of materials you can collect in this game decrease daily. Which means you would have to play more or less everyday in order to provide yourself and your crew a functioning home base. This isn't motivational, it is f*****g annoying and also f*****g ridiculous! I can't play everyday and so I decided to leave Story Mode alone and try the endless "Lifeline"-mode. I'll probably come back to the story someday, but I just don't understand the reason they built in this feature.Summarized, I hope there will be a sequel at some time, but please people, please don't let it have this ridiculous feature I mentioned above. I'm looking forward to playing DayZ.7/10Good Game, but incomplete and with some strange design decisions

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
												Short version:Standard Edition Owned = 5/10 - Skip it (unless making ammo in Breakdown is essential for you)No Version Owned = 8/10 - A really great zombie game with some slight RPG elements and a solid survival feel.Long Version:Having put a metric ton of hours into both this version and the old version, I can with confidence say there are some significant differences between the two.  Firstly, the actual entire reason I bought the YOSE version after having bought and played the standard version is that you can have the Munition shops now make ammunition in both the base game as well as breakdown.  This alone makes a significant difference in the gameplay experience, if you are one of those who enjoying going through all the levels of Breakdown.  It makes skilling your survivors out in guns skills actually worth it, which is something I wanted desparately from the start.  However, this REALLY should have been a free update rather than a whole new buy.  This fact alone makes this a hard pill to swallow and has made me question if I would buy anything from this company again.Graphics are much improved, however stuttering is still a big problem, mainly when driving around at high speeds.  This is particularly noticable in Lifeline as there is a lot of smoke and fire effects with most of the map being highway full of burning wrecks.  You need to have a beefy system, quite a bit more than even the minimum specs as it doesn't appear to be well optimized for PC (surprise surprise).  Even with an 8 core with 24 gigs of RAM and various Gforce 900 series cards, I still get significant framerate drops while driving around.  However, it is still impressive given there are no loading screens for the quite large open map.  Still, it looks nicer that the standard edition, but runs worse.As I said, you can now craft ammunition in breakdown and the base game, which is a game changer (for me anyway).  You can make snacks and coffee in the kitchen now as well.  A few more vehicles have been added like the Army truck from Lifeline is now available in Breakdown, as well as the ability to repair your vehicles in Lifeline, which is nice, not having to just ditch the Army trucks when they start smoking anymore.For me, most of the bugs from the old version have been cleared up, but some new different bugs have been introduced which can be just as annoying.  No more driving at full speed and then for no reason the physics engine decides it wants you to visit the moon, and launches you  500 feet into the air.  Your survivor then automatically bails out of the car mid flight, and you get to watch as one of your best survivors plummets to their death with nothing you can do but watch in utter horror.  Now however, doors/gates seem to offer very little benefit  with stopping zombies, since about 50-75% of the time, they just walk right through them, which can make things particularly frustrating (and deadly) in Lifeline sieges.So all in all you get a cleaner interface, some animation changes (blades skill animation has been tweeked slightly), better graphics, a few (very nice) guns, some olds bugs replaced by new bugs, the ability to craft ammo, snacks, and coffee, and some new survivors (Lifeline characters have been added to Breakdown).  If you own the standard game, and none of the things mentioned interest you, then I'd say give this one a pass.  If you don't own the standard copy and like zombie games, then I would absolutely recommend you get this version.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1
												I just got this game yesterday and it is already so fun. It has lots of elements on how a real zombie apocalypse would play out. If someone dies they are dead for good and the game saves all the time so you cant reset to where they are alive (I learned that the hard way).I do have some complaints, mainly that the controls are a bit clunky and the graphics could be better but overall a great game.I also love how the ultimate weapon in this game are cars. If you have a car you can last for forever and when you get out the zombies know that they have an opening and take full control over it. The car's horn helped me clear out many of the infestations and save many survivors. A little tip to anyone looking to buy this game... NEVER GO OFF ROAD WITH A CAR YOU WILL CRASH AND DIE! ALSO NEVER DO A MISSION WITHOUT A CAR BECAUSE THEY ARE EVERYWHERE! A car can take out basically every zombie I have come across so far. If they weren't so overpowered I would be more in fear of the hordes of zombies around every corner.It is still possible to die a lot even with a car and I love how nothing lasts forever in this game including survivors and have lost 2 of the 8 starting survivors already. It happened when I went off road while trying to rescue Jacob. I never got to know the character that died yet still felt sad and regretted my choice. Everything is life or death in this game and that makes it all the more fun.I would say this game is part The Walking Dead and part Dead Rising. The Walking Dead because you get to love the characters and truly feel bad when they die, and part Dead Rising because it is all out good times and chaos whenever you play.I also love how many things you have to take into account when managing your survivors and base. If you focus on one thing and not the other you will die a painful death. You truly need to manage every little thing about your character to survive. The clunky controls make it a little bit harder to get out of sticky situations but I still love the game none the less.If you aren't at least interested after all this who are you and what have you done to your personality. There is truly something everyone can love in this game. I haven't had the game crash on me yet like others have said and it runs well on my computer. I love this game and think you will to no matter what your preferences are.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												ok i have only played 7 hours to date and here is my thoughts.UPDATE: i am not going to waffle on this going back and forth. today i had a real issue getting the game to even work. the start up screen was windowed and would not respond in anyway with the mouse. after getting it to run the ai went bat♥♥♥♥♥♥crazy and i had no protection even inside my base. i was killed after a battle that should have drawn some attention. there was no guard in the tower and even when i was inside the gate the ppl were running right by me and not helping. i have had fun playing this and will have more fun playing it but just be aware there are issues. these issues should not be in a completed game. would think they would spend a little time to fix these problems but i know this is not going to happen. this will be the last game i buy from this company. if this company will release this with the problems it has they will release more games with other issues this i am sure of. the rest of my review stands. this is not a game breaker but it sure does not bode well for gameplay in general.i have played many zombie games and this one stands out as being one of the best. as with many of these games the mechanics seem to be the same. the same melee same third person view same same same.though it stands out to be among the best it is not without its flaws. i have read many reciews mostly the negative ones to see if i agreed. on some issues i do and some i do not and here is why.the ones i do not agree with are those that already owned the game that are crying that it is no improvement. well in all honesty most times it is not an improvement but a reskin of the same game as this is. though i do not own the original i can already tell that is what it is from reading so many reviews. it seems like a high percentage of those negative reviews are by those people that owned the original or those that played it on xbox and wanted the same experience on pc. fact is that will never happen as the two are so diffrent from hardware and player machanics i.e. keyboard verses controler. and if you look at those reviews alone your looking at a high percentage of 80 to 90 percent.to console users i say gfy many developers wouldnt even be creating games if not for pc and now pc is suffering due to all the cry baby antics of console users. most developers haven given in way to far to console players in general and that pisses me off as well look at bo3 for example. if not for pc users call of duty wouldnt even exist but now pc users are of no consern to the development of cod. ok on with the reviewcons.it does have flaws not magor but nerve racking in general1 the ai is wonky as hell i have experience the tower guard not being on duty and almost being mauled to death outside the gates.2 the zombies do respawn at an alarming rate. you will clear an area and run back to it after dumping off supplies just to find that there are 2 or 3x the amount  respawned. that in itself is garbage and shouldnt be.3 zombies will be in walls in fences in trees... umm ok4 after updating a base i run out for more supplies just to get a warning someone is sad and giving up? really i upgraded the base to make things better just for some ai to get sad and leave?5 it starts in window mode even after ive set it to be full screen? i have to go back and reset it everytime i play.6 lack of settings. again this is a port from a console so not much thought was put into the settings for pc.you have sliders that hardly work for everything. using a mouse on these is very hard and it seems where the pointer is  isnt accurate at all you have to fiddle with the mouse to get it just right to even attempt to use the settings.7 no save feature though it does this automaticly i am sure if you leave without it saving your going to lose things. that is why you leave after it says saving. lolthough these are bad and really bad  they are not deal or game breakers. the ai of the base though can be argued.the graphics are not that bad and i do not get where people are saying they are. only thought that comes to mind is they are on a very old pc with out dated video cards or something. the graphics are not fantastic like a new gen game but they are not horrible either and on par with say dead island or better then that i should say but not by much.again i have only played 7 hours to date but i have enjoyed it very much. the keyboard control is a bit weird but easy to get used to. the only part i am having issues with is sneaking and hitting z while moving. sneak is c and to kill a zombie while sneaking it requires z. all the while moving with the standard keys w a s and d not easily done.fighting is almost exactly like dead island but has other parts that dead island does not. that is what makes this game stand out. the looting and finding things though i agree with finding to much of certain items like twinkies for food.with not having owned the original to compare this to and having to judge this on its own merit i have to give it a thumbs up. it is not a horrible experience regardless of the many bad reviews it has been given. it is fun and i suposse it could become boring but if you play a certain game hours and hours sure its going to repeat and get some what boring. thats when you exit and go do something else and dont expect the game content:
Posted: February 7, 2016
												Honestly, this game is pretty bad whether or not you played the first one. This probably won't happen to you, but when I first started up the game, the sensitivity of the view was so high that everything was just a giant random flash of orange and brown light and some guy named Ed talking to me about cannibalism or something. The controls are so weird that i spent the first 10 minutes IN THE SETTINGS. Now, I'm not going to lie; the idea of managing your resources and the different characters is a fun idea. That part of the game is actually really good. Unfortunately, that's one of the only good parts of this game. The rest of it is just utter trash. Lots of the supplies' locations don't even make sense, the fighting is unrealistic, as well as the dialogue. Another problem that I have with this game is that everything is just TOO EASY. The game kills off some of the characters that you encounter before you can even get attatched to any of them and the game then proceeds to give them a dramatic sendoff. This game simply doesn't realistically depict what the zombie appocalypse would be like, the characters are too predictable, and the story part is just plain stupid. It's the same game as its original, but worse and slower. The good things don't outweigh the bad, the stupid, and the annoying things in the game.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												Another game in the recent zombie survival genre explosion, State of Decay is one that plays more action/adventure rather than horror survival like many other recent examples.  Despite frequent strange gameplay bugs and some oftimes frustrating camera movement, SoD is a stellar, and more importantly FUN, game.  The three different modes of play keep things interesting and allow for lots of replay value.  All in all, I highly recommend it if you enjoy both the genre and third-person action/adventure games.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												Fun game at first, but gets boring and repetitive after a short while. Seems like they had an idea for a game and then took a lot of input from the usual never satisfied gamers, you know the 'wouldn't it be cool if it was co-op?' or ' let us build bases but not have to manage them' or ' I want to play as a (fill in the blank) type person'. Bottom line it is a third person sandbox zombie survival game. No stratagy needed, no tactics and very lacking in the rpg department. Worth $30? No. Worth $10 sure.Pros:Open worldVehiclesDifferent styles of guns and melee weapons.Cons:Vehicles are to weak. A ♥♥♥♥♥ slimy rotton zombie is not going to total a 1/2 ton military pickup with a reinforced gated bumper. And really all I can put in it is 4 duffle bags of stuff, wish I could have told my Sgt. that in the army...lol. Oh and stop sighns and other little stuff causes severe damage to your vehicle too, and some of the zombies laugh at you cause when you come back, they put all the stuff you tore up your other car on back up.Combat is very clunky, have a zombie right in front of me, but my toon goes 5 steps away to hit a different one so that one can now get from behind. Partners are a hindrence, best to just leave them behind. They will hold one while your hitting three and get mad when you don't hit the one they are holding.Video and graphics are typical low budget stuff. A lot of pop ins 20ft away, makes it kinda hard to drive at max speed then suddenly a broken down car pops in or a horde right in front you. Then again, the pop in happens when you're walking and running.....SMH.Menus are a very bad port job. Sometimes they glitch so bad that keyboard shortcuts are the only way to make them work, mouse is yuky to say the least. No tooltips or very vague, scroll doesn't work well at all.Tutorial is basicly ' you are a survivor and zombies are everywhere, go make some friends and kill zombies.....end tutorial'Bottom line, good concept but poorly executed game. DLCs are just more of the same with achievement unlockers (see listening to whining gamer input) and a quick cheap storyline for the military. Game is steril and incomplete, would hate to have seen it before the graphics update. Best thing they could do is open up the sdk and let people mod it into a good game.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												I first played this game on my Xbox 360 years ago. I beat the main story, got maybe halfway through Lifeline and played a ton of Breakout. When I saw this game on Steam with all of the DLC included into one price and on sale, I just had to buy it.  I love this game. I feel like it's proabably nostilgia based since I have so many good memories from this game from my Xbox days but I do feel like it is a worth while game. The main story does have a lame ending but the DLC is great. I think the game looks fine, nothing too special but nothing too bad either. I haven't run into some of these supposedly "game breaking" glitches that people have complained about but there are a few bugs here and there. I lov ethe gameplay. The visuals are fine as I said but don't expect this Year One Edition to enhance anything. It's really just there to throw all the DLC in one place. I think if you are into realistic zombie survival and don't mind a lack of multiplayer you will like this game a lot. I know I sure do.

content:
Posted: January 9
												I really wanted to like this game.  An open world zombie game should be right up my alley, but I had to force myself to not give up on this.  It's hard to put my finger on why I didn't like it, I just wasn't having much fun.  The combat left a lot to be desired, in fact, I spent 90% of the time ramming zombies in a car, which got quite old after a while, but it's the safest, most effective way to deal with them.  But even the standard combat felt "meh."  Also, the missions left me feeling like an errand boy.  Go to this location, retrieve the resource, bring it back.  Over and over again.  So, after forcing myself to play for 5 hours, I finally gave up.

												English:I haven't seen the Steam Page for this game since it's release, and holy ******************************** , what's wrong with you guys??" If you Relog, everyone is Dead " Seariously? Never had this issue, one or two dead, ok, but everytime they were atleast " Missing in action " or part of an rescue mission. NEVER EVER was my base wiped out. Not in base game, not In YOSE Edition//DLC's" I can't even PLay it, it needs DX11 " Well, this is bad. But not really the fault of the Game, is it?" Not worth the money cause.... Its just bad " Most of this reviews got  a playtime under 5, most under 2 Hours. The Game is heavily grindy at the start.Kind of... Especially the Storymission slows you down if you are ahead/ want a new Base and have to go throught the neccessary Missions. That sucks, ok. But it doesn't make the game bad.Story Mode : You and your Buddy were camping as hell breaks loose. Youll fight your way down to an old church were Survivors hiding, and the fun starts. Almost every charactoer is kind of unique, and storymissions can have alternative Dialoges, perhaps outcomes with different characters. Hell Even sidecharacters from other survivor hideouts have Sideplots, if your lucky to stumble over them. Gunplay is way better then in the original, you can Unpack ammo crates for Ammunition, and the new CLEO missions are Pretty good. Atleast the loot can be awesome, unique weapons and stuff. Breakdown:Story mission without story. You fight your wayy throught hordes of Zeds, which get stronger with every run you make. As you go higher in the stakes, you can unlock more characters throught Challenges, there are fewer cars and more " Hero"-Zeds. The Unique, Bad-**** I kill you in one swipe ones xD. Screamers, and sorts. Can't remember the names, sorry^^Lifelinebasically another story-DLC. Shorter, but nice enought to play throught. Overall, with its crafting, basebuilding and managing this game is awesome. i bought it for...20? or 15 bucks, cause i had the previous SOD when it launches, but haven't had the dlc's. So it was a hell of a deal. Is it worth the 30 bucks ? Kind of i guess, but when its on sale for 20 or so, get it asap. you won't regret it.German:Irgenwie hab ich kb mehr alles neu zu tippen ^^.Ich versteh die reviews nicht, lest oben, das spiel an sich ist der hammer. Hatte es damals als es rauskam für 15 oder 20 euro bekommen da ich die alte version auch habe. Ansich hat mich das spiel noch nie enttäuscht, das Gameplay ist gut, steuerung vll bissle hakelig, aber durchweg ein Geiles Spiel mit den verschiedenen Basepositionen, Räumen die man bauen und aufwerten kann und das Managen der Überlebenden macht das spiel eigentlich extrem laune.Und Breakdown, quasi der survivalmodus ist auch richtig hart. Man hat eben auch nur begrenzte ressourcen. Irgendwann ist alles aufgebraucht, man muss also immer wieder fortschreiten im schwierigkeitsgrad,wenn es im sale ist, definitive Kaufempfehlung. Wenn nicht muss man eben für sich entscheiden ob man das geld ausgeben möchte oder nicht. ein schlechtes Spiel ist das auf gar keinen fall!

												things can get overwhelming with the amount of stuff you have to do!. you cant do everything in the game sadly you have 2 be wise in your choices of mission priorities, also keeping certain characters alive opens up new quests to them but if they die you cant finsh that quest thers always sumthin goin on its intense! either you are rescuing surviors, helping defend neighbours, scavenging for supplies or parts to complete a facility, seting up outposts, clearing out infestations, killing a certain zombie type in community 2 keep neighbourhood safe, building up your base etc etc alot goin down defo, and ontop o that u have 2 survive while doing all of this!! this has to be one of the most biggest maps i seen on any zombie game period!! it makes moon map on call of duty look tiny haha. If you bought the previous version of this game you get preppers pack & a new character a suv and some weapons. This game does make you think before you go out on runs i.e stocking up on meds weapons & guns/ammo etc.Alot of people have said this game should be coop its got all the makings of coop. you can play this game for hours literally there is a few character tweaks u can try for a challenge i suppose i.e reflex + heavy weapons. There are bugs in it but some make you laugh others look stupid but gameplay outweighs the bugs imo its got smooth gameplay also you have to be accurate when doing melee attacks because hitting them on stairs or hills you can miss swings/hits on them.                                                    ZOMBIES IN THE GAMENormal (4 -5 different types) /  FERAL /  SWAT / POLICE / SCREAMERS / JUGGERNAUT / BLOATER / INFECTED.id reccomend this game to any hardcore zombie gamer even has a hardcore mode (breakdown dlc)the game has 3 game modes: Story Campaign (SODYO), Campaign hardcore (BREAKDOWN) and  Army story (LIFELINE)iSOD YOSE you play through the story rescuing survivors along the way  build up ur base etcBREAKDOWN there is no story but your own you make all the choices and survive as long as you canLIFELINE you play as army soldiers and play through a story extracting VIP'S and defending your base from zombie hordes and learn of how the infection began. YOSE & BREAKDOWN are the same map in YOSE you are inclined to move to the warehouse whilst in BREAKDOWN you can choose anywere you want build up the area then escape.id give this game a 88 outta 100   (8.8 - 9)if it had coop then a 93/4 outa 100 (9.3/4)

content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												Probably the best zombie survival game out there. It has an open world feel in a town setting which helps immensely in making the town feel real. It was a surreal feeling as i was starting to learn the roads and ways to get back home recognising signs and houses as i drove by them while mowing down zombie hordes. Cars really make a difference making missions play out faster and a little safer though still quite dangerous especially when your vehicle has no driver side door allowing a zombie to pull you out of your car to make a flesh dinner out of you if you dont toss em off somehow. Having a car makes mowing down zombies which have formed a horde much more easier to tackle compared to the much more terrifying on foot melee combat. You will have many different types of vehicles at your disposal which feel great to drive and have a nice collision model with some good visuals showing car damage until eventually you have to abandon it as it begins to smoke eventually catching on fire. You can though with the proper base upgrades repair vehicles before they get too banged up.Of course you can always walk it which makes things much more dangerous as you have to bring food to keep your stamina up and medicine to deal with any possible injuries while evading any large gathering of zombies as the day fades into the night. You can defend yourself with melee weapons for close up combat and guns for long range attacks. You will be limited by what you can carry especially with supply stockpiles you come across but this can be remedied by using a vehicle for supply runs which allows you to load up multiple stockpiles to take back to the base where your friends and other survivors are.Going through houses and commercial buildings for supplies and survivors is creepy as you never know if there is just that one zombie you see slowly moving past a first floor window or if the place is infested by zombies in other parts of the house. With some stealthy movement you can scout the outside of the house looking into windows to get a possible idea of what awaits inside. That is unless a zombie sneaks up behind you as you struggle with it attracting the zombies in the house. Next thing you know the stealthy silence is shattered by an explosion of zombie moans and growls raging with crazed cannibalistic hunger for your warm raw flesh. Gathering supplies is needed to build your base and upgrade it over time allowing it to have more survivors living there while better dealing with the psychotic murderous zombies roaming the country side. Gathering supplies which are used daily, completing missions, bringing new survivors, keeping things peaceful between fellow survivors, cooking a nice big meal, brewing up a pot of delicious hot coffee among many other things helps to keep morale up at your home base. You will also gain influence points and fame which allows you to choose better equipment from the supply store and influence others to help you.You will be playing more then one character as you do missions you will become tired over time and need to rest. This is when another survivor can be asked to take the place of your current character out on the field while they rest up. As your characters grow and develop you will find yourself getting attached to them. When my characters died i was surprised just how it effected me and actually missed them afterwards feeling the loss along with people back at the base talking about their death. They also died in some incredibly blood thirsty gruesome ways which shocked even a gore hound such as myself. It felt strangely sad as another survivor i was playing came across my previous now dead character's backpack full of supplies as they picked it up to take back to base. The excellent journal log keeps tracks of all these events and effect it has on everyone. It is also used to give orders for things like base upgrades, seeing what quests are available and things like how other survivors are getting along with each other and the morale of the base.Weapons and vehicles can be repaired when the proper base upgrades are built. This is usually over night so it pays to use more then one type while the other is being repaired. Music is done very well setting the tone of a once normal world transformed into a unbelievable living nightmare which blends well with the home town family surroundings all around you constantly assaulting your mind with contrasting atrocities of flesh eating zombies feasting on the living.Graphics are interesting in the fact that they are not the greatest yet get the point across like a sledgehammer as you are suddenly witnessed to a brutal death and even more shockingly so if its your own. STATE OF DECAY: YOSE Day One Edition if i could call it one thing it would be the perfect George Romero's NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD simulator capturing a normal if not blissful country setting where unbelievable horror is occuring.

												As for an old Chinese player I think I'm a true fans of this game,In Chinese,players often play the "cracked" first,and  then decided to buy it or not.I played the old version of《state of decay》,to be honest,it really impressed me,sandbox and the storyline,even the special infected,it's real good,I mean,at least,it's original.And the guns,I must say it's awesome,I can say it's the best part of this game.even some old classical weapon appear in  this game:Mosin-Nagant 1895,M1 garand,M1918 BAR,and Thomson SMG!!!I finally pick up my faith in this game!But as for a new version,I can only say it's bad,too bad, let me tell you why:1.same story 2.some mode 3.even same bug!!!So how can I like it?bugs almost everywhere,yesterday,I finally find a Mosin-Nagant,and you know what happened?bug!I can't complete my mission,so I can't save the game,so I lost my deareeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeest rifle!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!And I don't know how these assh*les designed this game,some times zombies just suddenly appear in front of you,For example feral zombie,it just break me in to pieces!fuc,how can I play?????These just my opion.It's a good game(maybe without bugs)

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												Zombie survival game with more focus on sneaking round the zombies to gather supplies than just button mashing head smashing. Gather survivors and supplies while staying hidden from zombies.Overall 7.5/10ProsBase building and customization is good, improvements take real time and survivors use up supplies therefore realismSneaking mechanics are solidFighting zombies feels as hard as it would in realityDecent sized map with fair degree of variabilityGood sound mechanics mean zombies can hear you from outside the house you're searching or can hear you breaking into placesFreedom to choose your own home base site was niceConsThe campaign is quite short and ends very abruptly. Only really 5ish hours of work if you focused entirely on itQuite glitchy with zombies often teleporting through walls and doors

content:
Posted: November 17, 2015
												Let me just say after probably 70 hours of offline time painfully watching my allies die from both storyline and sheer acts of stupidy even a glitch where Sam kept running past the base I most dearly love to the  neighbor base that forced me to kill her with zombies cause I couldn't save otherwise. This game had pros and cons. I apoligize for any grammar mistakes.Otherwise to its a 4/5Pros - Great Storyline / Drama / Action for a RPG- Great selection of weapons- Painfully realistic but not so much you kill yourself on accident- Great selection of zombies for a balaced diet of hardcore and easy- Fast paced but dangerous - Balanced and Diverse sets of charcters you find that can progress to be more effective- All characters talk as if they where the main character when you control them.- Lovable option to press Alt and summon forth your powers on zombies- Lovable ways to travel in style Cons- Tideous as in excessive moments where your base is low on supplies and they can barally find it themselves even if its next door literally- Not enough choices in conversations to feel you can make a real impact on their opinions - They are amazing at combat except they do not understand how to equipment themselves aside from excessive snacks and painkillers. ( For insatnce we have a almost 50 guns and some don't even have a pistol in my base. )- They do not search enough for supplies to live on their own nor do they leave base in groups- You can't kill people who kill other people - There are little to zero moments where you just run into survivors or they come and find you- Zombies are literally endless in a shut off area for some annoying reason- You can get a whole pick up truck and a maximum allied group but you cannot order any of them help you carry items into the base or from an area. Additionally, you cannot take whats clearly infront of you or search it but instead have to wait 10 or 3 seconds to load a random group of items from some random lit up box and only carry enough to still be able to fight where optionally you can dump it or put it in a vehicle that looks huge but has as much space as a squarilles cheek. - There is no armor - There is no customization other than selecting upgrades for your base that leave a lot of open room where you would assume would let you put an extra upgrade but cannot

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												I enjoyed this game.  Some of the dynamics and story line are excellent.  I like it better than Left for Dead, and about the same as Dead Island though the games are somewhat different.  I got it at the Halloween discount, so at that price it was a steal.  The game seemed very much how I felt when I watched the walking dead.  When my first character died, it was a wake up call that this game felt real.  I have trhree complaints:  1) there was no way to stop the story chatter that prevents you from moving.  I like how Borderlands handles that.  You get the information but are allowed to go about your business.  2) the game ended quickly without much variation in content.  3)  The first DLC was disappointing - it felt like a repeat of the base game.  OKAY, I have a 4th.  The game could do a better job at conveying the rules to you vs requiring a lot of reading or trial by error.  Most games these days give you training sessions or small tidbits of information that help you get up to speed.This review was poorly written, but I have to get to work.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7
												State of Decay: Year One Survival Edition is a fun survival zombie game. Where you try to survive by scavanging containers for supplies while searching for other survivers. To stick together you must find a suitable location to turn into a base while you try to escape the infected town. State of Decay is a that is fun and interesting but for a short amount of time and here is why.The Graphics are decent, there not realistic or nothing but you can tell what things are in the game. From a zombie to a car and people.The day and night cycle is a cool machanic but its a useless one at that. The zombies are not tougher at night so going out during the night is the same as going out during the day.The  six different zombies are a nice in the game but the game calles them "freaks"instead of zombies. There six total "freaks" but there are about 3-5 close to each other. There is hordes as well which has about 5-10 "freaks". Toughest ones to kill are the juggernaut due to the amout of hits they can take. The zombie diffculty isn't that hard maybe on a normal difficult setting.The game-play is not that great. The game will lag a lot, items won't spawn in, some items will be unusable sometimes, "freaks" will glitch through doors, deflecting a "freak" works when it wants too, all A.I. are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and the game lacks survival. Skills and leveling are pointless in the game for you rarely "level up" in the game and when you you can only pick one skill per character to specialize in. Blunt, blades, pistols, shotguns ect ect. Only picking one to be good takes away the achivment of leveling a character. It feels like all your work in the game was for nothing.Supplies was one of the disappointing thing in the game. I was able to go out and raid every building, bring everything back in one hour. Once I did that, the "rashions" barley moved unless I chose to build or upgrade a station. Even then I was able to hit a few country places and regain the "rashions" I just used. Breakdown and Lifeline DLC are okay add-ons but Lifeline makes the game feel new while Breakdown uses the same map as State of Decay. I personally feel that Lifeline is the only DLC you need and not Breakdown. I had played 39 hours of the game and I can tell you that you could beat it lesser then my 39hrs if you know how the game works and knew what to do. This game looked and sounded to be good but it's not. Playing on low quality and still getting glitches, lag ect ect I really can't recommand this game to anyone at the asking price its at especially when it forces you to get the DLC. I'd wait for it to go on sale or something. I give this game a 5/10, just average game.Thanks for reading my review and yes I know I had spelling error. I have bad memory so can't remmeber how to spell words correctly.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												Buy this game, no really. Support the developer. It's fun for roleplaying in a zombie apocolypes or just plain fun if you like cracking skulls or building a base and micromanaging survivors.  This title has its flaws but a lot of it has been addressed in the Year One edition, such as the new vehicle inventory system. Only downside I have for it is the keyboard controls aren't the greatest, I would definatly recommend trying a controler. Also this would work great in multi player, hopefully Undead Labs will add that in the sequal.

content:
Posted: February 15
												This game is the "difinitive" zombie survival and is as close to "The Walking Dead" as it gets, closer than their crappy version of the game. It's as close to a zombie survival as it gets and the 3rd person prespective isn't so bad either. If there had been more research and co-op put into this game it would be the #1 3rd person zombie survival situation. And when i say this i don't mean to confuse with the "ultra", over-blown zombie games...i don't classify this game in with them. It's not as fast paced and you're not FORCED to go all out for the majority of the game.What utterly SUCKS about this game:No safety when you climb: If the game glitches, during a high climb, and you're pushing toward he ladder....you're DEAD. Horrible Lighting: This game is made darker than dark and the gamma is all you have, it's crap.Glitchy controls: This game is slow to respond to "keyboard/mouse" players (at times) so you might end up doing the same attack sequence after the zombies are dead or running too far or snapping around too soon (or too slow) and you end up getting bitten because of it.Clipping: This game clips like a MOTHER and you will see it all throughout this game.NO CO-OP: This game would be 10x better with co-op and it looks like they're going to SCREW up "State of Decay 2" by leaving the co-op out of it as well. This game would still be on the Top 20 list IF there had been co-op.My last thought here, if you like the game...PLAY IT. Never let anything, that someone else tells you, "completely" dissuade you from playing a game...it's just one person's opinion. It was just too much drive space, for something that's already been done, to me...In NO way am i implying "like what i like"....i'm just telling you how it felt to me....there is no right and there is no worng, there is only perception from the experience and that's what i'm verbalizing here :)

												Spend alot of hours playing this. This has very good replay value and you can always try something new in each playthrough. This might not be cutting egde technology but it does the job. Graphics are decent, UI is great and easy and sound is great as you will be using it alot on higher difficulty. There's lots to play through here in form of main game plus two DLC's which each enable more features and even more content, fully voiced with story and new items. But the "area" you play in is huge and it will take many hours alone just to explore it all. If you're a Walking dead fan and interested in survival of groups of people, building comunity and help others, this is the probably the best game for just that, i've played atleast. Despite many bad reviews due to some relaunch issues at beginning, this is a good and stable game which can be further added with many mods made available via Nexus.

content:
Posted: April 15
												I've been meaning to write a review of this for so long--the main game IS good. It's really fun BUT you need a lot of patience and really gotta work on strategy to survive and keep all your characters alive.One playthrough I was kicking major butt and suddenly my character Marcus' (which was my favorite cuz I had him crazy leveled up) head got ripped completely off. I was so mad I uninstalled the game. I thought F this all that work and then that happens???But I went back to it eventually and tried it again, but without trying to rush through everything, without the mindset of guns blazing (which I think was part of my problem). Went much much better. And I eventually finished the game, satisfied for the most part. The constant respawning of zombies, and Lilly's voice constantly radioing was really the only thing I found extremely irritating.Breakdown seems super pointless to me, so I haven't really gotten too far into it. Lifeline was good in the way that it showed the military's perspective, and in a city environment. But the ending of it felt abrupt, like there should have been something more afterward.Overall I'd say yeah you should buy this game. Most of the reviews I've seen have been about specs and all that  "oh it's a ripoff cuz graphics aren't any better blah blah blah." Who cares??? The graphics are fine, doesn't ruin the experience. Try it--try it around Halloween, it's really fun around that time. :)

content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
												I played the demo of this game on xbox and it was pretty good. I picked it up during the steam sale, and it's like a more casual singleplayer DayZ with a story. You have to swtich characters or they get tired, build up your base and protect it from hoards and special infected. There is supposedly limited ammo for the whole game, however in what I've played, there is just so much around that it's not something I have to worry about at the moment. However over time some guns will run out of ammo sooner than others. Your characters can die, even if you're not playing as them. I just lost Maya.... She was my second favorite character to play as. She had high melee and shooting stats but... A zombie jumped on her and killed her... It was the last one. Why did you have to die Maya.... I'll miss you forever. You were there since the begining... almost... You were the third person with a name, but like the 7th I met. I still miss you Maya...However there are some faults with the game. Often times the game has frame dips, and takes a while to load. It is a "Seamless open world" however certain zones take time to load and I even crashed into the edge of the world (It didn't hurt my car) because the game didn't finish loading as I was driving by with a fast car.

number of helpful: 8 of 18 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
												State of Decay was originally released in 2013 on the Xbox 360 and PC and two years later in 2015 we have a remaster known as Year One Survival Edition. I originally played the game in 2014 on my Xbox 360 and had hours to spend on it. I decided to buy the PC version when a new version of State of Decay was released, but the original version was taken off steam. I'm going to be reviewing the actual game itself, if you want to know the difference between this remaster or the original, then these are the differences. The game has been remastered, so that just means better graphics, less bugs and problems and more smooth gameplay, and the game has ticked all those boxes. But the most notable difference is that this version contains all the DLCs for free. If you have already got the original State of Decay on your PC, then I do not reccommed you buy this. Unless you want the DLCs and improvments to the original and you're willing to pay £23 or around $30 for this, just stick with the original. Onto the actual game itself, you start off at a fishing lake getting attacked by zombies or as they though it was 'a cannibal family picnic'. You end up at a police building where you meet some other survivors. You and your friend, 'Ed' search houses and find a woman who's friends were killed. Eventually you make it out of the mountains and into a town where you meet a girld called 'Lilly' who you met on a radio. After that, you have your own free will to do whatever you feel. The story is slightly bare as the cutscenes are just as advanced as the camera system you have when you're still playing. But the gameplay is what makes State of Decay so good.No other game is like State of Decay, it's a bit like  a mix of GTAV, DayZ and Telltale's The Walking Dead. If that appeals to you, you will love this. As the game is open world, you can go anywhere in the Trumbull county. There are several towns to explore and lots of long countryside roads, but you will spendf most of your time inside the town your base is in and looting it. There are some vehicals to drive which you will probably blow up in 10 minutes and attract a load of zombies and there are tons of buildings to loot. But knowing where to start is up to you. This game makes you make choises by your own instinct.Combat is very well designed when your attacked by zombies. You wack them with a mele weapon or just beat them to death. One zombie is easy, even ith no weapons and low stamina, you could take one on and not lose any health, but when your attacked by a dozen, it gets hard. You will automitically lock onto the zombie your facing and repeatedly smash it until it's head breaks. But when another zombie attacks you from behind, it will jump on you forcing you to try and shake it off. One thing to know is that this game is slightly over the top with gore. You can sneak up on a zombie and kill it by grabbing onto the head and smashing it on the the floor. Not to mention this game has some finshing moves that look badass. In terms of weapons, you have a lot but only really two types of mele weapons. If your using things like hammers, hatchets, cricket bats, you do quick slashes on zombies that take about five hits. But if you use big sledgehammers or an axe then you will do big swings at the zombies taking only three hits, but more time. This is simular to Skyrim with one and two handed weapons.In terms of guns, they nail this too. You will often be scrounging for weapons, and you may come across a gun shop or police department, in that case, bingo! Because guns are very useful in some cases, in some missions you will have to protect NPCs from zombies by barricading houses and attacking the zombies. Often you are left with no choice but to shoot some, especially some of the 'freak' zombies. When you scavenge for ammo, you will not find a lot, making every shot count. You can get many guns, pistols, rifels, assult rifels, shotguns, even grenade launchers (not common).AI is alright, the zombies aren't meant to be Einstein so they are pretty easy to sneak past when you are crouching. But when your trying to survive the apocalypes, you may make a lot of noise, and this noise willcertainly attract zombies. Shooting, driving, running, jumping, fighting, scavenging will lure zombies towards you, which can be difficult because you will be doing a lot of the previously listed activities. This is also useful when you need to make a distraction, using firecrackers will make lots of noise, attracting zombies in the area so you can get past or loot. The actual zombies come in many forms, some are stronger than others but the strongest are the 'freaks'. These zombies are much more tough or deadly, especially juggernauts. These are huge zombies with look like they have mixed DNA with a bear and tank, these are incredibly hard to kill.Your community is controlled by you and your influence. Influence is kind of a 'symbolic currency' in your community which you can use to spend on different things. You can ask to find supplies or make outposts where you can store supplies or make facilities in your base, the concept is very useful. You earn influence by doing missions such as saving people, finding people, finding supplies, killing 'freaks', looting houses, talking to people and other activities. Your community also needs to feel safe, so that means you need lots of supplies and not a lot of zombies in your town, and no infestations. These are a sort of nest for zombies where they live and eat and if you don't clear infestations, your community may slowly fall apart.You can find new members to join your community to help you survive, but this also means another mouth to feed, and supplies are rare once you have scavenged most of them. Your map shows the whole of Trumbull county and has crosses on the houses you have already scavenged. So sooner or later you will need to find a way to escape Trumbull county by following the main missions which lead to an alright story, what you would expect off a zombie survival game. I personaly had no problem with the ending, but I know many found it dissapointig. But this is a spoiler free review so I will not say anything else.There are several vehicals to drive, but as I previously mentioned they tend to be about as safe as petrol and fire. Some vehicals are big and protected with a lot of space to store supllies and some are small and fast with little protection. One thing to note is that youi can change your character to go on house raids or when your character dies you can change to another member of your community, and then find the supplies of your last character. This game also has a very nice soundtrack along with very nice graphics. I remember the first time I tried to go on a scavenge in State of Decay was at night and I was too worried to fight the zombies in case it attracted more. So I was just sneaking from bush to bush, hiding from the zombies, along with the beautiful soundtrack.But like most games, I do still have my fair froblems with the game. First, you don't really feel any connection to the other members of your community, when another member joins, it just means less space but more help. The only characters I ever really cared for were Marcus (the character you start with), Lilly, Ed (your friend at the beggining) and Maya (another early character you meet). And the game is slightly buggy. It doesn't feel very polished at times, but this is easily passable by the fun gameplay itself.Overall, if your looking for a zombie survival game that isn't just buggy multiplayer or the slaughter of millions of zombies, I can't reccommend this to you enough. Despite the lack of polish this game has, you will get hours of fun from it.9/10 Not a masterpiece, but real damn close!

number of helpful: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
Intro TL;DR This is a 3:rd person scavenge and survival action game with RPG elements. It is set in a post-apocalyptic setting where most people died and then stood up again. This game is for you if you like exploring under tension,running slightly simple mission and building a small society. These are the things you need to be able to overlook.    -    Auto save that you have absolutely no control over.     -    Game world has poor and inconsistent persistence. Zombies often spawn in when you can see them. Cars can get repaired whilst doing nothing. Areas don't stay cleared (due to random spawn-ins)    -    Some of the missions you get are of a "You're a school teacher who needs to hold everyone’s hand"-type    -    Game can be repetitive. Some missions feature you haveing a talk with a given character. When you for the fifth time do that mission with the exact same dialogue it just feels lazy.     -    The game has no Cooperative play mode. This could seriously mitigate most of the negatives.     -    The menus are cumbersome to use.     -    I've built at least a few facilities because I clicked one to many times on something whilst finding out what that facility was.    -    You cannot cancel facility being built    -    Physics are twitchy. Be careful about flipping your car full of loot...A few tips for enjoying the game.  Whenever a slightly different mission shows up. Do it. You'll get enough of the repetitive ones anyway  Use the radio tower to find resources you need.    Recruit people when you can  Extend the base as much as possible.   Don't be afraid to move.  Build outposts around the base. Really does help.  What did I like about it?    +    Big gameworld to explore. Nothing is locked down. Go out there and explore.     +    A bunch of characters to choose between.     +    Characters actually die and are gone from play after that.     +    You do have some control over how the settlement survives based on resources gathered, facilities built and outposts settled    +    Game has a mechanism for how much sound you make. It works pretty well.     +    I like the palette
