content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												This is a great classic game title and with mods and graphics enhancements it's even better. Started out on a bad note because for some reason my gtx 950 ssc kept popping it's gpu clock speed down to 418mhz from a base idle of 1189mhz when I'd start the game. After awhile and some tweaking I was able to get it all to work fine so at the 2hr nonrefundable point that makes me happy.  I recommend getting the Year One edition, go to Nexus Mods, search 'state of decay' and search YOSE under that title and a few mods will come up. Unfortunately many of them don't work anymore, but there are just enough mods there to give the game a good refreshing. So get this if you don't mind having to spend some time fine tuning and even yelling at it a bit. It's worth it. Don't get it if glitches and squirrely gameplay get on your nerves.Edited 12/8/16: Experiencing the lock-up glitch way too often. I just can't recommend this game until that issue is fixed.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												I should probably point out that the original state of decay was the first ever open world zombie apocalypse game that I played. Long before DayZ, H1z1, etc. I put 46 hours into the original version of this game. I bought this version hoping for more, but basically just got the exact same game with updated graphics and sound and some general improvements to gameplay. If you've never played the original state of decay, I would suggest you play this... but I think the price of $30 is too much. Buy this game while it is on sale.PROS:-You are in an open, zombie infested world and can essentially go wherever you want and do basically whatever you want as long as you live. You have to rest though and the bigger your group is, the better off you are, as long as you keep supplies stocked. There is a story and you have to follow it if you want to beat the game, but technically you can just survive and explore as often as you prefer.-You can grow a garden, build a medical center and can craft sniper towers in your base. There is some customization of bases in this game and it is interesting.-You must maintain supplies such as food and medical. You can raid houses, factories, schools and collect weapons and loot.-You can recruit other AI players that you meet, or you can deny them. You can let them into your group and if they start acting crazy you can send them packing or help them. You can control several different characters in the game and can decide who you want to play as, as you go.-You can establish a base where you can build a small community of survivors.-There are vehicles throughout the world you can take and drive. You can use the trunk to stash extra supplies to transport to your base. Driving around in this game feels a lot like the open AI world of Grand Theft Auto-Different types of zombies provide various levels of challenge to kill. Sometimes hoardes come upon you while you are raiding a house for loot and you end up having to barricade yourself inside "Night of the Living Dead" style.-The story, acting and soundtrack are all excellent. They keep you interested and engaged in the game.CONS:-There is no online mode. You cannot play co-op or with anyone online. This is a single player game only. This is a massive strike for some people, but understand that this is still a great game without online.-You have to play this game in 3rd person. There is no option for 1st person.-There is no way to customize your characters. You have to play as the survivors on the game. Lack of customization. You can techincally mod the game unofficially, but it can cause crash problems.-The map lacks very large structures to loot inside of, such as a large hospital or large schoolhouse. You spend most of your time looting houses and small shacks or warehouses.-There are no real destructable environments. Sure houses burn down and cars explode... but that's about it. You can't pull a fire axe out and chop a hole into a wooden house.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 18, 2015
												After 4 hours of play I already have a love/hate attitude for the game. Concept is good, but events thus far have felt very scripted for an "open" game world. Graphics are decent, love how my laptop is able to stay relatively cool while running. Shooting and targeting objects appears to be fluid for distant combat, but melee combat turns into an inchorent, frantic button mash (there doesn't appear to be any visual targeting for melee like there is for ranged fighting). Had to adjust the mouse sensitivity big time.  My character gets "sucked" into animation sequences during melee combat which kind of sucks (kind of like a RB in an older Madden game getting hit by a defensive lineman, animation sequences once triggered appear to have no way to get out of) There is a dodge button somewhere but there is no tutorial or message on that feature, it's something you'd have to look up in the controls. There are help messages for some of the controls but it's the basic ones over and over again thus far. The death sequences are well done, gets kind of addictive splattering zombie brains. The bad is that zombies tend to spawn in the middle of walls and fences, while also having a terrible respawn script running. You'll be walking in a forest and all of a sudden a zombie will respawn right next to you. You'll clear an area out only to have zombies magically reappear instead of them walking to the area from an offmap starting point. The UI has a good layout but terrible functionality attached to the buttons. Easy to accidently purchase a feature with your influence currency, particularl when you're starting out and learning the controls... which leads me to saving. There is no save functionality. It's all automated. Which doesn't work for the flow of the game. You'll want to be slow and quiet, which means you'll have spent many minutes/hours of playing and need to go do something  in real life yet there is  no way to save except for reaching end of missions and "magical" save points. Getting in a car is no fun whatsoever. The controls are bad, and it doesn't even feel like you're driving a vehicle on earth, it's more like piloting a paper airplane in space. It's been fun to level up a character, but the inability to not switch to other members in the group until the game decides it's ok is very annoying. I would purchase the game again for the $30 price, overall experience has been 75-83 range on a 100 scale, it's just really disappointing that some of the features are the way they are...And probably would have been♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at anything more then that. (Have not purchased played the earlier version which is no longer available, this has been my first experience). If I could give a sideways thumbs I would, but will go with thumbs up, there's been enough good to overcome the shortcomings thus far.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												So where to begin, State of Decay is flawed and depending on the kind of person you are these flaws are fairly easily overlooked for a period of time until things kick in with force so for now the simple pro's and con's of the game before further elaboration:Pro's:- Lots of characters and the DLC only adds to that across 3 scenarios (SoD, Breakdown and Lifeline)- Good base building actiongs albeit a touch limited- Weapon diversity, even if it pretty much boils down to guns, melee and throwable- A fair bit to do if you're a 100% completion person as some of the challenges are more time comsuming than they are hardCon's:- Whilst the action is good to begin with and the whole concept of the game is great (in my opinion) after the first 20-30 hours it's very much the same "get this" "save that person" "go here" type of quests- AI is as dull as a sack of hammers and in the Breakdown DLC (as far as I've seen) the AI doesn't use firearms unless they're in the watch tower at base- You have to do pretty much everything yourself (see above for partial explaination) as the AI doesn't simply go out in force and search for you whilst you're away over the hill putting a slug between a zombies eyes- The bugs, whilst not as bad as people make it out to be, I've had some serious "wut?" moments like driving down a road only for the car to hit something and over turn leaving my character hurt, carless and the ensuring explsion luring everything undead in for a good 500 metersDespite everything this game is easily one of the more enjoyable games I've had a chance to play over the years, whilst not perfect is a solid basis for the series as State of Decay 2 is meant to be in the works. I won't try to play down the bugs as they can be a royal pain or a source of amusement but in literal sense if you're unlucky a bug in game can be the difference between your best survivor making it home goodies and all or being torn in 2 by a freak class zombie. The core game play itself is solid if a bit rinse and repeat after a while, the DLC alters a few things with the likes of lifeline but its very much of a sameness but with a military setting. Breakdown isn't exactly hard as it is trying, as you progress levels you'll get less resources and more zombies / freaks as a result giving what I feel is a false sense of difficulty as they all take the same damage and dish it out but the sheer volume causes the fight or flight moments.TL;DRAs a whole the game is good, not perfect, but decent enough to keep a zombie fan interested for a while. Anyone with a short attention span may want to avoid it however base builders and to an extent RPS players may enjoy it for its limited RPG like character stats. 7.5/10

content:
Posted: March 13
												A few bugs (e.g. ombies suddenly teleporting through closed doors), but they aren't enough to distract me from what is a thoroughly enjoyable game. Other reviews have drawn parallels with the Walking Dead. I can see why. but don't expect this game to be as strongly character-driven as that. Each character does have unique characteristics and traits, but they don't seem to have much actual impact on my tactics or weapons loadout. So long as you're a bit cautious (i.e. don't dive into a horde with just a crowbar to hand and expect to walk away - although it can be done) you can manage to deal with most situations using any character. There are exceptions like the military being more receptive to characters with a military background.DLC - Breakdown is more of a sandbox version focussing solely on survival.Lifeline is focussed on a different, more urban map where you play as the military who end up cut off from supply and reinforcement, so you need to balance progress against survival with dwindling loadout of the chunky weapons you start off with. Different enough to add a lot of additional gameplay and enjoyment.Definitely worth a play.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
												This is a good game with core elements that I really hope the developers build upon in State of Decay 2. It's best features are that there is a lot going on - you feel like you have to keep up with various responsibilities, like keeping your base's resources up, ensuring your survivors are happy with each other, saving your neighbours and recruiting more people. The zombies also come in force - it feels like the zombies scale well in number, although cars are overpowered when it comes to mowing them down (if I drove through a group of humans my car would be totalled and I'd probably be injured in the process = here you can slice through a horde of zombies). I felt cars were a little too easy to come across, they're everywhere and there's no limit on fuel for them. I like having a base of operations where you stockpile resources, and the 'influence' "currency" is a great concept (although I think it'd be better for individuals to have their own influence ranking rather than a groupwide influence pool). The main negatives are that the game can be a bit easy - I didn't lose many survivors at all and my base never felt under any real threat. I want the game to punish you more without it becoming boring by requiring say lots of walking. I found the most enjoyable section of the game to be after the tutorial when you're in the church - there's a lot to deal with, most of its in walking distance and it felt like the game was more alive. If the developers take these positives, add base building and micro management of survivors, State of Decay 2 could become the definitive zombie game.

It is unlikely they will fix most of the bugs in this version too.

												For me, this game has hit a sweet spot. Is it perfect? of course not. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												So where to begin, State of Decay is flawed and depending on the kind of person you are these flaws are fairly easily overlooked for a period of time until things kick in with force so for now the simple pro's and con's of the game before further elaboration:Pro's:- Lots of characters and the DLC only adds to that across 3 scenarios (SoD, Breakdown and Lifeline)- Good base building actiongs albeit a touch limited- Weapon diversity, even if it pretty much boils down to guns, melee and throwable- A fair bit to do if you're a 100% completion person as some of the challenges are more time comsuming than they are hardCon's:- Whilst the action is good to begin with and the whole concept of the game is great (in my opinion) after the first 20-30 hours it's very much the same "get this" "save that person" "go here" type of quests- AI is as dull as a sack of hammers and in the Breakdown DLC (as far as I've seen) the AI doesn't use firearms unless they're in the watch tower at base- You have to do pretty much everything yourself (see above for partial explaination) as the AI doesn't simply go out in force and search for you whilst you're away over the hill putting a slug between a zombies eyes- The bugs, whilst not as bad as people make it out to be, I've had some serious "wut?" moments like driving down a road only for the car to hit something and over turn leaving my character hurt, carless and the ensuring explsion luring everything undead in for a good 500 metersDespite everything this game is easily one of the more enjoyable games I've had a chance to play over the years, whilst not perfect is a solid basis for the series as State of Decay 2 is meant to be in the works. I won't try to play down the bugs as they can be a royal pain or a source of amusement but in literal sense if you're unlucky a bug in game can be the difference between your best survivor making it home goodies and all or being torn in 2 by a freak class zombie. The core game play itself is solid if a bit rinse and repeat after a while, the DLC alters a few things with the likes of lifeline but its very much of a sameness but with a military setting. Breakdown isn't exactly hard as it is trying, as you progress levels you'll get less resources and more zombies / freaks as a result giving what I feel is a false sense of difficulty as they all take the same damage and dish it out but the sheer volume causes the fight or flight moments.TL;DRAs a whole the game is good, not perfect, but decent enough to keep a zombie fan interested for a while. Anyone with a short attention span may want to avoid it however base builders and to an extent RPS players may enjoy it for its limited RPG like character stats. 7.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 18, 2015
												After 4 hours of play I already have a love/hate attitude for the game. Concept is good, but events thus far have felt very scripted for an "open" game world. Graphics are decent, love how my laptop is able to stay relatively cool while running. Shooting and targeting objects appears to be fluid for distant combat, but melee combat turns into an inchorent, frantic button mash (there doesn't appear to be any visual targeting for melee like there is for ranged fighting). Had to adjust the mouse sensitivity big time.  My character gets "sucked" into animation sequences during melee combat which kind of sucks (kind of like a RB in an older Madden game getting hit by a defensive lineman, animation sequences once triggered appear to have no way to get out of) There is a dodge button somewhere but there is no tutorial or message on that feature, it's something you'd have to look up in the controls. There are help messages for some of the controls but it's the basic ones over and over again thus far. The death sequences are well done, gets kind of addictive splattering zombie brains. The bad is that zombies tend to spawn in the middle of walls and fences, while also having a terrible respawn script running. You'll be walking in a forest and all of a sudden a zombie will respawn right next to you. You'll clear an area out only to have zombies magically reappear instead of them walking to the area from an offmap starting point. The UI has a good layout but terrible functionality attached to the buttons. Easy to accidently purchase a feature with your influence currency, particularl when you're starting out and learning the controls... which leads me to saving. There is no save functionality. It's all automated. Which doesn't work for the flow of the game. You'll want to be slow and quiet, which means you'll have spent many minutes/hours of playing and need to go do something  in real life yet there is  no way to save except for reaching end of missions and "magical" save points. Getting in a car is no fun whatsoever. The controls are bad, and it doesn't even feel like you're driving a vehicle on earth, it's more like piloting a paper airplane in space. It's been fun to level up a character, but the inability to not switch to other members in the group until the game decides it's ok is very annoying. I would purchase the game again for the $30 price, overall experience has been 75-83 range on a 100 scale, it's just really disappointing that some of the features are the way they are...And probably would have been♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at anything more then that. (Have not purchased played the earlier version which is no longer available, this has been my first experience). If I could give a sideways thumbs I would, but will go with thumbs up, there's been enough good to overcome the shortcomings thus far.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 13
												A few bugs (e.g. ombies suddenly teleporting through closed doors), but they aren't enough to distract me from what is a thoroughly enjoyable game. Other reviews have drawn parallels with the Walking Dead. I can see why. but don't expect this game to be as strongly character-driven as that. Each character does have unique characteristics and traits, but they don't seem to have much actual impact on my tactics or weapons loadout. So long as you're a bit cautious (i.e. don't dive into a horde with just a crowbar to hand and expect to walk away - although it can be done) you can manage to deal with most situations using any character. There are exceptions like the military being more receptive to characters with a military background.DLC - Breakdown is more of a sandbox version focussing solely on survival.Lifeline is focussed on a different, more urban map where you play as the military who end up cut off from supply and reinforcement, so you need to balance progress against survival with dwindling loadout of the chunky weapons you start off with. Different enough to add a lot of additional gameplay and enjoyment.Definitely worth a play.

content:
Posted: January 6
												Currently there are very few game developers that are not too lazy to do good games or too scared to do hard games.Is this game perfect? No. But it's good and just being good is atm a very rare badge of honor.As for people complaining, well for me as a person who lived under socialism it is so much fun to watch a crowd of westerners DEMAND from a free market agent something as if it were their social due.Advice to any reader out of the squabble - this is one of the rare enjoyable games with an ever increasing difficulty curve from old school style easy (i.e. casuals might still struggle) to really difficult. The genre is survival on the run with temporarily upgradable buildings and depletable loot and it is not very mod friendly so do not expect to be able to mod it into endless survival in one place, but for what it is, it is one of the best.I can't say 'buy it now' because part two is coming, but if you are collecting good games - wait till the first 50% discount and grab it.

Posted: January 6
												It is the ultimate Grand Theft Autoish game in a zombie world. Its a great survival game, with solid base building and good RPG elements. Control is fine, action is good enough and combat is deeper than it seems at the begining, since progression opens up unexpected new avenues. Graphics are probably not in the top nowadays,but for me they do their job and I ended up liking them more than I thought. The story part is nothing to die for, but at least it makes you feel part of a post apocalyptic world and throws in some nice details that in the end, bring the world alive and believable.The map is probably a bit limited, if you want to read a con. And both DLCs are just average.Wonder how I managed to miss this one so far. Now I cant wait for State of Decay 2.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 26
												I played through the original game on the Xbox 360 and enjoyed it very much. If you also played it through I do not recommend the game, it is only good for new players or if you want to experience the DLC.Pros:-Gameplay: Simplistic yet addictive survival-Characters: Decent and after playing them for a while you will care about keeping them alive-Bases: You have the ability to change your home base-Limited amount of resources: All vehicles, resources etc. are limited so if you trash the car you are driving you better find a new one-Base Management: Upgrade your base with new "buildings" which provide you with buffs or completely new features-Multiple "Main" Characters: You play as all of your survivors and have to switch when others get tired. Makes you care also about others and you want to level them up for later.-Progression: Has a decent progression system with levels and "perks" which you can choose to differentiate between the specialization of each character.Cons-Horrible last gen console port!!!!The graphics are awful, the graphic settings are very lacking and the performance is very poor compared to the graphical fidelity. The game does not support 1440p and should be locked at 60fps. I have a 144hz 1440p monitor but I am forced to play at 1080p with locked 60 using Riva Tuner to get a decent gaming experience. This is unacceptable in the modern day. If the new game will be the same way I will refrain from buying it.-You Should Use a Controller: The gameplay is ok with a mouse and keyboard, but you really should use a controller for a more fluid gaming experience.-Bugs:Still has many of the same issues as the original Xbox 360 version had. Some bugs are minor others rather troublesome. I have not yet had massive issues, but the bugs are still annoying.-The Graphics:I mentioned them before, but they are just so awful I have to mention them twice. This game looks worse than the original Fable on the original Xbox. Fable had good graphics for the platform it was on and for the time it was made, this game doesn’t.ConclusionI have to recommend the game as I enjoy it very much. I have not yet found a better alternative for a action base-building walking dead type game so this game is the best one out there. It has its flaws, but if you are willing to look past them the game itself is great.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 16
												First time I tried was on my quad core laptop. Laggy, choppy bad experience. Got myself a nice shiny new AMD FX-8370 8-core rig and what a world of difference. The game is about as close to a "Walking Dead" or generic zombie apocalypse experience as I can imagine.PROS:Game is pretty easy to pick up and figure out combat-wise even for an old guy like me. The atmosphere is great, the vehicles are easy to use. I felt pretty studly until I walked into a house with primary character and got jumped by a mini-horde. Torn to pieces, pretty jarring moment, but I have no problem with the permadeath as it raises the stakes. The base building options give you something to work towards. I have not experienced the glitches that others have (jinxed!).CONS:Now, note that these "cons" are on me cuz I suck. Slow reflexes, more of a strategy gamer so.. I've lost so many main characters already, I think I am on #5. He's doing pretty well but got exhausted really fast and I had to quit and play something else. That was a bummer. Once you lose so many characters you can't switch between people. YOu have to shut down the game for a few hours to rest/heal. There are healing options as I understand it, but haven't got there yet. I'm really only 8.5 hours into it and slowly starting to get a feel for it. I hope there is a way to regain a playable second character or I may have to start over. Again, these are all my own issues and not knocks on the game. I can't say anything negative about it at all in fact! I'm having fun, just wish I didn't have to shut down to rest!A must try game for all fans of Romero, TWD, etc. Highly recommend it!

content:
Posted: April 13
												This is about the Sandbox Mode and not the normal story mode / campaign!! Best Zombie Shooter/Survival game I have ever played. Characters feel real, both melee and ranged combat are fluid, group managment is quite fun thanks to perma death, stealth is nothing new but fulfills its purpose, and the world has a very walking dead tone to it. There is a bit of story that wil make you do some missions but the game mostly benefits from the "make you own adventure" aspect. You just get thrown into the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and then you figure everything out from there. I really enjoy that concept.And all of this in a single player! Shows that not every game has to go multiplayer. Unfortunately at a certain point the game gets boring due to the fact that the map will be completely explored and gathering materials and saving the same characters is not really interesting at end game. The graphics are bit dissapointing especially when it comes to the overall color of the game (but thats just a matter of taste i guess). However the journey is amazing and fells very immersive. Now add the mods (crossbow is a must) that are out there and you have a great game. Very recommended for zombie enthusiasts.

												If you dont have the orignal game then by all means its a great buy. I dont see much difference between the original and this copy i feel like i was cheated out of 20 bucks. The game is great but if you have the orginal and the DLC there is no point in getting this version. Instead of wasteing time doing this they should have put the effort into co op. This game would be great to play with friends. And from what i have seen with the fan base many of us want a co op option.
